catalogue_raissonne: Finberg 10; Lister 15b (lettering around edges removed before printing)
creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: nude couple at a bed at center, one figure seated and the other standing; richly decorated, dark room; basket of fruit or yarn on the floor, sickle at L; at R, dark scene with sheep and crucifixes in URC; whole image is framed by arched beams
inscription:
in graphite inside mat: 953

note on letterhead with print: William Weston Gallery / 7 Royal Arcade / Albemarle Street / London W1x 3HD Attn: Mr R. Campbell / Chamber Idyll sent on instructions of John Andrus. With Compliments.

In addition, another piece of letterhead with description of print.
provenance: [William Weston Gallery, London, no. 2492/5; sold to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Chamber Idyll
